abstracts.cdata!:
This is the resettlement action plan
            (RAP) for the Inland Waterways and Port Rehabilitation
            Project, and, aims at ensuring that all project affected
            people (PAP), as of the date of the socioeconomic survey
            (November 1995) will improve, or at least regain their
            standard of living; be relocated as village units, village
            sections, or families, as the case may be; be integrated
            into the community to which they are resettled; be provided
            with appropriate compensation for asset losses at
            replacement costs, as well as with adequate social, and
            physical rehabilitation, infrastructure, including housing
            lots, community services, and facilities; and, participate
            in the design, and implementation of the resettlement
            planning. The RAP is based on the policy on land acquisition
            and resettlement, on the principles of resettlement,
            compensation, and subsidiary policies, on rehabilitation
            assistance for income restoration, and, on public
            participation, consultation and grievance mechanisms, as
            well as on institutional aspects. Compensation shall be
            available for all affected structures, and fixed assets at
            replacement costs without depreciation, to be paid in cash,
            or in kind, in the form of building materials, i.e., bricks,
            cement, etc. Salvageable materials are to be collected by
            PAPs for re-use - no reduction will be made for salvageable
            materials. Individual cases will be ruled by a Resettlement
            and Relocation Committee, and the RAP stipulates that all
            compensation will be paid prior to displacement, subsistence
            allowances will be given, preferably in kind, and job
            training will be imparted to minimize economic hardships on
            displaced families.
